page.title: 04Changes to the countryside
page.content: In late Spring many fields are bright yellow due to flowering{oil seed rape. This is relatively new made popular by {European Economic Community}subsidies to farmers. This has led to over-production and{lupins}grown for oil (with similar subsidies) may replace rape. Some{hedgerows}have been grubbed out to enlarge fields for machinery.This has encouraged soil erosion but is not extensive. The land usage survey suggests many{natural {woodland copses}are disappearing. Cut-backs in local council spending leave lanes{pot-holed}and{overgrown} with{cow-parsley}&{red campion}running riot.These untouched lanes have encouraged birdlife & small mammals.{ {Rabbits}flourish resistant to{ {myxomatosis}and{foxes}are common.{ {Bluebells,primroses,poppies and {dogroses}are adundant in season.
